alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Monroe (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 7:22PM CST until January 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... White River At Clarendon affecting Arkansas and Monroe Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY, JANUARY 23... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River At Clarendon. * WHEN...Until Sunday, January 23. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, River flows in many side channels and creates islands between the river and sloughs and creeks. Flooding of cropland and timber is occurring. Portions of the National Wildlife Refuge downstream of Clarendon flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 26.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.8 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday, January 22. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date White River Clarendon 26.0 26.7 Fri 6 PM 26.8 26.8 26.7 26.8 6 AM 1/15 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
